meanings.definition: To give shape or visible structure to (a thing or person).
meanings.sent1: She used her hands to formate the clay into a beautiful vase.
meanings.sent2: The architect will formate the blueprints before construction begins.
meanings.sent3: The kids tried to formate a fort out of blankets and pillows.
meanings.sent4: His words seemed to formate a clear picture in her mind.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brush strokes formate a stunning landscape on the canvas.

meanings.definition: A salt or ester of formic acid.
meanings.sent1: The laboratory assistant prepared the formate for the experiment.
meanings.sent2: Formate is commonly used in the production of leather.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally added formate instead of salt to the dish.
meanings.sent4: The formate in the solution reacted with the other chemicals.
meanings.sent5: The formate crystals sparkled under the microscope's lens.
